# Hallmarks of good studies

<font style="font-size:24px"> 1 Informative designs </font><br>
<font style="font-size:18px"><i> Conduct the best possible test of your hypothesis? </i></font><br><br>

<font style="font-size:24px"> 2 Sample size planning </font><br>
<font style="font-size:18px"><i> Determine how many observation you need for clear-cut conclusions? </i></font><br><br>

<font style="font-size:24px"> 3 Registrations </font><br>
<font style="font-size:18px"><i> Register your hypotheses before data collection. </i></font><br><br>

<font style="font-size:24px"> 4 No p-hacking </font><br>
<font style="font-size:18px"><i> Conduct only planned tests or report as exploratory. </i></font><br><br>

<font style="font-size:24px"> 5 Full reporting </font><br>
<font style="font-size:18px"><i> Report everything you did. </i></font><br><br>

<font style="font-size:24px"> 6 Replication </font><br>
<font style="font-size:18px"><i> Replicate your findings. </i></font><br><br>

</font>
]
